activity_json.title: A tutorial introduction and Getting Started
activity_json.text:
Prerequisities:
  1. Students have to have an Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (Stable version) on their machines
  2. Make sure that the students will have a GCC compiler installed on their machines

Read the Chapter - 1 from the textbook The C Programming Language - Second Edition (Page Number: 5)
Textbook link:Textbook

activity_name: A tutorial introduction and Getting Started

options.option: Statements that specify the computing operations to be done and variables store values used during the computation
Variables that specify the computing operations to be done and functions store values used during the computation
Variables and Statements constitute together a function
Only statements that specify the computing operations

questionText.text: A function consists of: (Check all that apply)

options.option: Character String
Character Array
String constant
String Literal

questionText.text:
The sequence of characters "hello, world
" is called as (Check all that apply)

options.option: Main
Start
main()
None of the above

questionText.text: A _______  function that will call other functions to start the execution of the program. (Check all that apply)

activity_name: A tutorial introduction and Getting Started - Quiz

activity_json.title: Variables and Arithmetic Expressions
activity_json.text: Read the Chapter - 1 from the textbook The C Programming Language - Second Edition (Page Number: 8)

options.option: Will be ignored by the compiler
Can be able to understand by the user what the particular program or statements does
Will throws the error to the user when compiled the program
Purpose Is multiline comment
Purpose Is a single line comment

questionText.text: Any characters between /* and */  (Mark all that apply)

options.option: Declared before they are used usually at the beginning of the function
Declared where ever you want before it can be used
No single variable can be declared before they are used
All variables must be declared only in the main function

questionText.text: In C, all variables must be: (Check all that apply)

options.option: %d
%f
%s

questionText.text: Which are the following are the format specifiers in the printf statement to be used to print floating values (Check all that apply)

activity_json.title: The For Statement
activity_json.text: Read the Chapter - 1 from the textbook The C Programming Language - Second Edition (Page Number: 13)

options.option: It consists of three parts, multiple initialization statement, multiple conditional statement and multiple increment or decrement statement and followed by statement block
Initialisation, conditional and increment or decrement statements are optional.
All the three statements (initialization, condition and increment or decrement statements) are compulsory
None of the above

questionText.text: Which of the following statements are valid for "for statement"? (Check all that apply)

options.option: The compiler throws an error to the user when compiled
The for loop runs infinite number of times
Prints 10 for indefinite number of times
Prints 10 twice and terminates

activity_json.title: Symbolic Constants
activity_json.text: Read the Chapter - 1 from the textbook The C Programming Language - Second Edition (Page Number: 15)

options.option: #include
Const keyword
#define
None of the above

questionText.text: Which of the following directives defines the symbolic constant (Check all that apply)

options.option: Lower Case
Upper Case
Mixed case (Upper and lower case)
Alphanumeric characters

questionText.text: The symbolic constant names are conventionally written in (to differentiate between variables and constants) (Check all that apply)

activity_json.title: Character input and output
activity_json.text: Read the Chapter - 1 from the textbook The C Programming Language - Second Edition (Page Number: 15)

options.option: Read the input from the standard input - keyboard
Read the input from the file
Prints the output to the file
Reads the data in a variable

questionText.text: getchar() is a functions which is used to (Check all that apply)

options.option: Read the input from the standard input - keyboard
Read the input from the file
Writes the value to the file
Prints the value to the standard output - Monitor

questionText.text: Putchar is a function which is used to (Check all that apply)

options.option: Returns a character after reading from the input
Returns value 1 after successful reading from the input. The value that is read from the input will be by default stored in a variables
Returns value 0 if its failed reading the input
None of the above

questionText.text: getchar() is a function that (Check all that apply)

activity_json.title: Arrays
activity_json.text: Read the Chapter - 1 from the textbook The C Programming Language - Second Edition (Page Number: 22)

options.option: Integer expression or Integer variables
Integer constants
Floating values
Character constants

questionText.text: A subscript can be (Mark all that apply)

options.option: Random locations in the memory
Override the existing values in the memory if the memory is not sufficient
Contiguous locations in the memory
Either in primary (RAM) or secondary storages (Hard Disc)

questionText.text: The elements of the array will store in (Mark all that apply)

options.option: From the index where the elements actually stores in the array
From the length of the array

questionText.text: Array index starts with: (Check all that apply

activity_json.title: Functions
activity_json.text: Read the Chapter - 1 from the textbook The C Programming Language - Second Edition (Page Number: 24)

options.option: getchar and putchar
while
printf
main

questionText.text: Which of the following that you think are functions: (Mark all that apply)

options.option: Power is a function name that take two integer arguments and returns an integer value
This function returns the base value to the called function
This function returns the value of n to the called function
None of the above.

questionText.text: int power(int base, int n) (Mark all that apply)

activity_json.title: Arguments - Call by value
activity_json.text: Read the Chapter - 1 from the textbook The C Programming Language - Second Edition (Page Number: 27)

options.option: By values
By references
Initialises to default values
Assigned to garbage values when the function has been invoked

questionText.text:
Based on the following function declaration, the parameters are passed by:
int power(int a, int b);

options.option: When the value of the variable is changed in the called function, the variable’s value will also change in the calling function
When the value of the variable is changed in the called function, the variable’s value will not change in the calling function
If the value of the variable is changed in the calling function, the variable’s value will not change in the called function
If the value of the variable is not changed in the calling function, the variable’s value will not change in the called function too

questionText.text: Which of the following are applicable when a function is called by value where the arguments names are same in both the calling and called functions? (Check all that apply)

activity_json.title: Character Arrays
activity_json.text: Read the Chapter - 1 from the textbook The C Programming Language - Second Edition (Page Number: 28)

options.option: It is an array of characters containing the characters of the string and is terminated by 0
It contains only the characters of the string as an array.
All the characters of the variable will be stored in a variable (not an array)
All the characters of the variable will be stored in a variable (not an array) and is terminated by a 0
It contains unicode characters as well.

questionText.text: How the string in C will be represented in memory? (Check all that apply)

options.option: The above function copies all the characters from a to b
The above function copies the last character of b to a
The above function copies all the characters from b to a
Syntax error.
None of the above.

activity_json.title: External variables and scope
activity_json.text: Read the Chapter - 1 from the textbook The C Programming Language - Second Edition (Page Number: 31)

options.option: Register storage class
Static storage class
Automatic storage class
Extern storage class

questionText.text: To access a variable that can be used in multiple source files of a program that should be declared as: (Check all that apply)

options.option: Register storage class
Static storage class
Automatic storage class
Extern storage class
Declare outside of all the functions

questionText.text: If the same variable is used across multiple functions in one source file, then it should be declared as? (Check all that apply)
Write a program to copy its input to its output, replacing each string of one or more blanks by a single blank
Write a function reverse (s) that reverses the character string s
